intro: Pachylobus afzelii, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant has a thick, fleshy stem and produces milky sap, which is a common feature among members of its family. Its leaves are opposite and often have a waxy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Pachylobus afzelii is typically found in open woodlands and savannas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
